case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman presents to the    dermatology clinic with inflammation of her fingernails that first appeared 5 months ago and recently worsened. She reports    wearing    acrylic nails for the last year, remo ving them just bef   ore the clinic visit. On examination, th e patient has erythema and swelling of the lateral nail folds and hyperpigmentation of th   e proximal nail folds of all fingers on her ri ght hand. Examination also reveals nail dystrophy, onycholysis, and an absence of cuticles. She has not t   ried   any treatments for this condition.
